Posts.Content: stadown wrote: i recent had to move onto adriamycin after taxol/carboplatin stopped working.  i guess i should have know that tc stopped working when my hair started to grow back and i had to shave my legs.  i have had 1 treatment of adriamycin and scheduled to go tomorrow for 2nd, but i am thinking its not working.  its been 3 weeks and i have not lost any of the new hair that has grown back and i have to shave my legs again.  sorry for the details about shaving my legs but i have been using that as a gauge to know if chemo is working.  i will be getting a petscan in 2 weeks to see if its working.  anyone taken adriamycin and not have hair loss?? Dx 8/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 9/17/2009 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 10/28/2009 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 3/6/2010 Breast Dx 10/22/2012, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/15/2012 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/28/2013 Adriamycin (doxorubicin) Hormonal Therapy 5/1/2013 Chemotherapy 6/19/2013 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Gemzar (gemcitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: adriamycin - working or not? stadown stadown

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2013 08:24AM stadown wrote: Sorry if i caused any stress to you onedayatatime!  I truely didn't mean too.  With the TC that stopped working and progression to my liver, i am starting to feel that nothing will work. I did notice this morning some stray hairs in the hat that sleep in so i guess my hair is deciding to fall out again slowly.  I was just started to like my gi jane look!!
Posts.Title: adriamycin - working or not? stadown stadown

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2013 11:30AM stadown wrote: Thanks for all the encouragement since i am stressing out all day everyday.  i have scan scheduled for 4/1 to check if adriamycin is working.  i am going to have to ask my onc about tumor markers.  he has never said anything to me about them however i did get an insurance claim for over $750 for the month of January but can't imagine that was for just the 2 blood draws they did following chemo for cbc.
Posts.Title: adriamycin - working or not? stadown stadown

Posts.Content: stadown wrote: I was on taxol/carbo for 4 rounds.  after first 2, onc did pet scan and was working wonderfully.  after 2 more rounds, pet scan showed spots came back and progression to my liver.  so upsetting that only after 4 rounds, it stopped working.  i also have had very platelet counts with tc.  i start on adriamycin next week.  i am sad because my hair is growing back and will probably loose what i have again.  any advice on adriamycin for those that have had/having it?  working or not working? Posts.Title: changing to adriamycin - thoughts? stadown hydeskate

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2013 05:30AM stadown wrote: So sorry to hear Penny.  Are you currently on chemo?  What drugs? I am scheduled for PetScan on Monday and dreading it.  The last one showed further progression to my liver but the size of the finding was unable to be determined due to poor differentiation of the adjacent soft tissues (right of the report).  My onc says that means they just can't measure it.  So i have no idea of the size to even compare to my next scan.
Posts.Title: Scan today - put me to sleep until I get the results redwolf8812 Bondgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2013 07:59PM stadown wrote: I am scheduled every three weeks for treatment.  my oncologist has said nothing to be about options other than chemo probably because at this point i have a lesion on chest /pectoral muscle, nodes in lungs and nodes on chest lymph nodes.  the progression to liver was recent.  taxol/carbo worked wonderfully for 2 treatments as the lungs were completely resolved and chest lymph node shrunk from 2.7cm to less than 1 cm.  now nodes in lungs are back and the liver thing.  thanks for for the link, i will be sure to check it out.
Posts.Title: changing to adriamycin - thoughts? stadown hydeskate

Posts.Content: stadown wrote: I am excited yet nervous about my petscan today.  we will see if chemo is working, same or worse.  Since i have no hair, i would assume something is working, hopefully not just killing my good cells!!  Results in a few days!! Posts.Title: petscan today stadown dbla

Posts.Content: stadown wrote: I had a lumpectomy in 2009 at first diganosis.  I have mets to chest lymph nodes and lungs.  After 2 chemos, I had petscan and lungs were almost completely resolved and lymph node went from 2.7cm to less than 1 cm.  My sister asked me if would have a double mastectomy after i was done and hadn't really thought about it.  But the more i do, i think i should.  if these things are causing the issue with the cancer, why not get rid of them.  I have read a lot where oncologists say "why, its already out of the gate" but if i can get to NED then lets stop the madness that coming from my breast??  Anyone else out there have a mastecomy after chemo even at stage 4?  Anyone else thinking about it?  Am i just crazy?? Posts.Title: mastectomy after chemo?? stadown sheryls

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2013 01:00PM stadown wrote: thanks for all the comments.  i believe either my surgeon or oncologist said that doing the surgery won't prolong my life but i think it can only help so that the area causes the defective cells are gone!!  i do look back and say if i would have done it the first time around would i be in this situation now? i don't know but encourages me to have it done.  best wishes to all!!
Posts.Title: mastectomy after chemo?? stadown sheryls
